dt: {bc}to shrink in size, number, or degree {bc}{sx|decrease||}
{bc}to reduce in size, extent, or degree

pt: {sc}decrease{/sc} {sc}lessen{/sc} {sc}diminish{/sc} {sc}reduce{/sc} {sc}abate{/sc} {sc}dwindle{/sc} mean to grow or make less. {sc}decrease{/sc} suggests a progressive decline in size, amount, numbers, or intensity.
{sc}lessen{/sc} suggests a decline in amount rather than in number.

pt.t: has been unable to {it}lessen{/it} her debt

pt: {sc}diminish{/sc} emphasizes a perceptible loss and implies its subtraction from a total.
{sc}reduce{/sc} implies a bringing down or lowering.
{sc}abate{/sc} implies a reducing of something excessive or oppressive in force or amount.
{sc}dwindle{/sc} implies progressive lessening and is applied to things growing visibly smaller.

shortdef: to shrink in size, number, or degree : decrease
to reduce in size, extent, or degree
to represent as of little value
